message.welcome: Welcome to the Flutter Translate example app!

presentation.welcome: Welcome to the Companions of the Tour de France!
presentation.discover: Come and discover how to become a Companion of the Tour of France! Answer these 20 questions and find out your own companion name! Are you more of a Noble Heart Dauphinois or a Frank Orléanais? Let's play!

questions.text: First city Toulouse! I am Abel, I am 22 years old, I started by discovering the world of building by learning the carpenter trade. But it's as a roofer that I committed to the Tour de France.
Question 1: But what is the Tour de France?
Good answer! The Tour de France is a journey where the future companion changes cities every year.

Question 2: The first city to welcome me was Toulouse. I am with about thirty other young people, various trades are represented: carpenter, joiner, cabinetmaker, plumber, baker and the best: roofer! Among these photos, which model was made by a roofer?
Good answer! The roofer's mission? Install the roof and rainwater drainage elements.
The year passed quickly, we are already in June, time to change cities. I take this opportunity to send a postcard to my grandmother, she always enjoys it.
Question 3: You will find on the wall this famous postcard. What do I remember from this first year? (Two correct answers)
Good answer! The companions are one big family!
I leave my roommate, my brother in heart and work. He is not a roofer but we can use the same materials: He is a plumber.
Question 4: Plumbers also make models. What is the main material of this model? Hint, the Limoges station is covered with it!
Good answer! Did you know that copper changes color when it oxidizes? This is why the roof of the station is green!

Second city Mouchard! Here I am now in my second city of my Tour de France: Mouchard in the Jura. You will find the Lycée des Compagnons there! Mouchard is the place of excellence to discover the values of the companions! I share my room with a painter! This training is very popular with budding graphic designers!
Question 5: You can find several works done by painters. One of them represents the emblem of the city of Limoges, can you recognize it?
Good answer! This emblem represents the flames of the furnaces necessary for the production of porcelain and enamels. Limoges is the capital of the fire arts!
Question 6: In your opinion, what is the purpose of this last one?
Good answer! Doing the Tour de France is a marathon towards excellence. The young itinerants constantly seek to improve themselves. This is illustrated by the study works.
Let's not forget those who start each project: the masons! Masons have a strong identity in Limousin, especially the masons of Creuse! They have greatly contributed to building Paris!
Question 7: What does this masterpiece made by an itinerant Mason represent (photo)?
Correct answer! The flying buttress is used to support the walls from the outside. You can observe them near the museum by walking in the park and contemplating the cathedral.

Third city Bordeaux! Now it's been two years since I left on the Tour, strong from these first two years it's with great enthusiasm that I put my bags down in Bordeaux! I hasten to write this news to my grandmother.
Question 8: I am so taken with this new city that I forget to name it! I prefer to talk about my first classes there. What is their particularity?
choiceAnswers: They are in the evening and on weekends
correctAnswers: They are in the evening and on weekends

questions.text: Good answer! The Tour de France itinerants are professionals who work during the day like all employees. Advanced training classes therefore take place during their rest time: evenings and weekends.
This year, I meet my fellow Mason from Mouchard, he is nearing the end of his Tour and is carving his reception model.
Question 9: Here is this model, was it made by a single itinerant?
Good answer! This model has the particularity of having been made by several people. Today, models are mostly made individually.
This year, I decide to present my model to validate the first step to become a Companion.
Question 10: In front of you is a work shaped by an itinerant roofer, in your opinion, who was it intended for?
Good answer! The models must be presented and validated by companions of the same trade in order to validate the skills of the young itinerant.
The time to present my model has come. This presentation does not take place in a classroom, but on a specific date: that of Saint-Eloi, the patron saint of roofers.
Question 11: What is this event called?
Good answer! The patronal feasts are an opportunity for companions and itinerants to meet once a year. These celebrations are national and specific to each trade society.

My model is validated, then I am recognized as an aspirant. When I return to headquarters to find my room, the guardian of the place insists on congratulating me: she is the mother. In each house of the companions, there is a mother. She ensures cohesion and welcomes young itinerants.
Question 12: On the board in front of you, can you find out in which year the Bordeaux companions' mother was received?
Good answer! The Bordeaux mother was then named Mrs. Lassalle, she was received as Mother of the Carpenters during Saint-Joseph, the patronal feast of the carpenters.
During an adoption, each young aspirant is then given a scarf in the colors of his society!
Question 13: I am a young companion roofer, can you guess which one belongs to me?
Good answer! Three colors exist according to the rank. For roofers:
You are now in front of an emblematic object of the companions, the cane! Like the scarf, it has a very important place in the symbolism of the companions.
Question 14: Among these canes, can you find the one of a blacksmith?
Good answer! The cane was once the support object of the Tour de France, as it was done… ON FOOT!

Fourth city Lyon! My journey continues and I have now arrived in my fourth adopted city, Lyon! Today, the Tour is no longer done on foot, otherwise I would have covered 512km, which is 5 days of non-stop walking.

Question 15: Arriving safely, evening classes resume, we are supervised by a companion cabinetmaker. Today, cabinetmakers are rare! For his reception, he made a table in 2003, what is its particularity?
Good answer! The reception masterpieces - to become a companion - have the particularity of being chosen by their maker. Each masterpiece represents the personality of its creator!
Closer to my roofer profession, but still a wood trade, framing is essential to any building.

Question 16: In 2004, a carpenter was received as a companion. We are lucky to have before us the two major steps: the full-scale drawing - a template - and the model. How many colors are on this template?
Good answer! Note that originally no colors existed! They were added to help visitors understand the layout.

Fifth city Limoges! I have now arrived in my fifth city: Limoges. This will be my last city, it is the year when I have to carve my reception! It is a test and a challenge both human and technical! I continue to send news to my grandmother by postcard, waiting for the mail to work on patience!
Question 17: In this postcard, I write many details about the course of this last year. What are they?
choiceAnswers: The assignment of my companion name
The reception during a patronal feast
correctAnswers: The assignment of my companion name
The reception during a patronal feast

questions.text: Good answer! Yes, all these proposals are correct! And it would take much more to describe this unique experience!

The reception models represent a passage, from the young itinerant to the received companion, from learning to the recognition of technical know-how. You can see a plaster column on its plywood pedestal. This reception model was received in 2017.
Question 18: The painter made a dedication to two cities that are dear to him: the first city of his Tour and his last. Can you recognize them?

Good answer! To represent Limoges, he chose to paint the headquarters of the Compagnons de Limoges surmounted by the Saint-Etienne cathedral. It is this same view that you will be able to observe when leaving the museum!
A companion's life does not end with his reception. We belong to a family, it is with pleasure that we give back to the youngest what we have learned. We thus devote two years to the itinerants.

Question 19: I stay in Limoges for an extra year. I am 'the roller', I accompany the youngest. During this period, I discover the museum of the Compagnons de Limoges! How many masterpieces in the shape of a hat are there?
Good answer! Hat's off! There is a specific hat for rollers: it's the top hat! (Photo)
Years have passed, I am a sedentary companion in Bordeaux. I have kept the values of sharing and solidarity, I still appreciate meeting my companion brothers and sisters around a good Bordeaux wine!
Question 20: Here is an original and imposing masterpiece: a wine cellar inspired by picnic baskets. What are the wood species used?
Good answer! Congratulations! The quiz is over! You have been perfect! Like any worthy companion, one last question follows to give you your own budding companion name!
